page.title: 06South West Water Authority
page.content: There are four jars to show the four different stages of purifying water in the Reception. First we went outside to see the water tanks. The water comes from the River Fowey at Trekeive Steps and is pumped up into the tanks: there were 24 tanks altogether;none of which were full. After that we went to the control rooms where there were four controls, one for each main tank. We watched the sand and gravel start to clean the water.This is called rapid gravity filtration. Chlorine is then added to the water in controlled amounts and whenever it is used the workmen have to wear protective clothing. Lime is also used to purify the water so that when you wash your knives and forks they do not turn black. It also sweetens the water. The best bit was seeing the container of lime _ it held 80,000 gallons.
